page.title: 08FARMING-PORTPATRICK
page.content: More than three-quarters of the survey area is farmland,divided almost equally between dairy/beef cattle and sheep,with enough barley and grass being harvested ( as silage or hay ) to feed the livestock over the winter, so making the district self-sufficient. All farm produce in the area is in surplus,according to the{E.E.C. and local farmers having achieved cost efficiency ranking with the best in the world, look to an uncertain future of cutbacks in support from Goverment, unable to agree that they can produce a surplus when so many in the "Third World" are experiencing{famine!
